title: Simulate a single state for the M4MA — simulate,state-method
text: object Object state-class. model Object predped-class. add_agent Logical denoting whether agent added simulation. Defaults FALSE typically handled simulate function, accounts variables add_agent_after max_agents. group_size Numeric matrix two columns first column denotes number people social group second column probability group added simulation. Defaults 100% probability individuals added simulation (.e., social groups). velocities Numeric matrix containing change speed agent whenever move respective cell matrix. used create cell positions agent might move . Defaults matrix columns contain 1.5 (acceleration), 1, 0.5. orientations Numeric matrix containing change direction agent whenever move respective cell matrix. used create cell positions agent might move . Defaults matrix rows contain 72.5, 50, 32.5, 20, 10, 0, 350, 340, 327.5, 310, 287.5 (note larger angles actually negative symmetric versions smaller angles). standing_start Numeric denoting factor preferred speed agents move just came standing still. Defaults 0.1. close_enough Numeric denoting close (radii) agent needs object order interact . Defaults 2, meaning agent can interact objects 2 * radius(agent) distance away. space_between Numeric denoting space left object created path points agents (radii). Defaults 2.5, meaning space 2.5 * radius(agent) left object path points agents use strategy. stay_stopped Logical denoting whether agents predict others currently moving remain immobile next iteration. Defaults TRUE. time_step Numeric denoting number seconds discrete step time mimic. Defaults 0.5, half second. precomputed_edges Output compute_edges containing nodes edges agent can use plan path. Defauls NULL, triggering creation edges whenever needed. many_nodes Logical denoting whether use minimal number nodes use many (see create_edges). Ignored precomputed_edges provided. Defaults FALSE. plot_live Logical denoting whether plot iteration simulation going . Defaults `FALSE`. plot_time Numeric denoting amount time (seconds) wait iterations, .e., time updating plot. Defaults `0.2`. report Logical denoting whether report whenever agent reorienting. Defaults FALSE, usually needed feedback. print_iteration Logical denoting whether report simulated iteration. Defaults FALSE, can switched desired. step_report Numeric denoting iteration report current iteration simulation & number agents present current iteration simulation. Defaults 1, represents iteration reported. goal_number Numeric, vector, function defines number goals agents accomplish. exact value handled determine_values. Defaults \(n) rnorm(n, 10, 2). goal_duration Numeric, vector, function defines duration goals agents. Defaults \(n) rnorm(n, 10, 2). precompute_goal_paths Logical denoting whether run find_path generated goals beforehand. Assumes agent goals order goal stack. Defaults FALSE. sort_goals Logical denoting whether order goal stack logical way. Currently implemented following way. First, select first goal one closest starting position provided argument starting_position. , define next goals one closest position previous goal. Defaults TRUE. adaptive_goal_sorting Logical denoting whether agents ability change order goals adaptively throughout simulation. Defaults TRUE. precomputed_goals List goal stacks agent can assigned one. Defaults NULL, triggering creation goal stacks simulation. middle_edge Logical denoting whether sample goals middle edge objects link[predped]{background-class} (TRUE) allow goal locations fall points edges (FALSE). Defaults FALSE. position Numeric denoting position like assign agent added simulation. Defaults NULL, making agent start entrance. Note experimental feature tested yet, therefore might work moment. individual_differences Logical denoting whether use standard deviations parameter list create variation parameters. Defaults FALSE. cpp Logical denoting whether use Rcpp alternatives several lower-level functions (TRUE) whether use R alternatives instead (FALSE). Defaults TRUE. ... Arguments passed plot method (plot_live = TRUE).

title: Simulate a single state for the M4MA — simulate,state-method
code: # Create a setting in which to simulate. Note that this setting also serves # as an example of one-directional flow, which can be seen if you let the # simulation run a bit longer. my_background <- background(shape = rectangle(center = c(0, 0),                                               size = c(2, 2)),                             objects = list(rectangle(center = c(0, 0),                                                      size = c(1, 1))),                             limited_access = list(segment(from = c(-1, 0.5),                                                           to = c(-0.5, 0.5)),                                                   segment(from = c(0.5, 1),                                                           to = c(0.5, 0.5)),                                                   segment(from = c(1, -0.5),                                                           to = c(0.5, -0.5)),                                                   segment(from = c(-0.5, -1),                                                           to = c(-0.5, -0.5))))  # Create a model from which to simulate my_model <- predped(setting = my_background,                     archetypes = c("BaselineEuropean"))  # Create an initial state with no agents in it my_state <- state(iteration = 0,                   setting = my_background,                   agents = list())  # Simulate the next state next_state <- simulate(my_state,                        model = my_model,                        add_agent = TRUE)  # Check the number of agents in the next state length(next_state@agents) #> [1] 1  # If you wish to plot the new state, you can use the plot function. plot(next_state)

text: agent Object agent-class. state Object state-class. background Object background-class. seen Logical indicating whether agent can see path point currently moving. standing_start Numeric denoting factor preferred speed agents move just came standing still. Defaults 0.1. close_enough Numeric denoting close (radii) agent needs object order interact . Defaults 2, meaning agent can interact objects 2 * radius(agent) distance away. space_between Numeric denoting space left object created path points agents (radii). Defaults 2.5, meaning space 2.5 * radius(agent) left object path points agents use strategy. precomputed_edges Output compute_edges containing nodes edges agent can use plan path. Defauls NULL, triggering creation edges whenever needed. many_nodes Logical denoting whether use minimal number nodes use many (see create_edges). Ignored precomputed_edges provided. Defaults FALSE. adaptive_goal_sorting Logical denoting whether agents ability change order goals adaptively throughout simulation. Defaults TRUE. report Logical denoting whether report whenever agent reorienting. Defaults FALSE, usually needed feedback. print_iteration Logical denoting whether report simulated iteration. Defaults FALSE, can switched desired. cpp Logical denoting whether use Rcpp alternatives several lower-level functions (TRUE) whether use R alternatives instead (FALSE). Defaults TRUE.

title: Update the Goal of an Agent — update_goal
text: Object agent-class.

title: Update the Position of an Agent — update_position
text: agent Object agent-class. state Object state-class. background Object background-class. agent_specifications List created create_agent_specifications function. Contains information agents within current state allows communication predped simulation functions m4ma utility functions. velocities Numeric matrix containing change speed agent whenever move respective cell matrix. used create cell positions agent might move . Defaults matrix columns contain 1.5 (acceleration), 1, 0.5. orientations Numeric matrix containing change direction agent whenever move respective cell matrix. used create cell positions agent might move . Defaults matrix rows contain 72.5, 50, 32.5, 20, 10, 0, 350, 340, 327.5, 310, 287.5 (note larger angles actually negative symmetric versions smaller angles). standing_start Numeric denoting factor preferred speed agents move just came standing still. Defaults 0.1. time_step Numeric denoting number seconds discrete step time mimic. Defaults 0.5, half second. report Logical denoting whether report whenever agent reorienting. Defaults FALSE, usually needed feedback. print_iteration Logical denoting whether report simulated iteration. Defaults FALSE, can switched desired. cpp Logical denoting whether use Rcpp alternatives several lower-level functions (TRUE) whether use R alternatives instead (FALSE). Defaults TRUE.

title: Getter/Setter for the utility_variables-slot — utility_variables
code: # Initialize agent my_agent <- agent(center = c(0, 0),                    radius = 0.25,                    utility_variables = data.frame())  # Access the utility_variables slot for the agent utility_variables(my_agent) #>   agent_idx check ps_speed ps_distance gd_angle id_distance id_check id_ingroup #> 1        NA    NA       NA          NA       NA          NA       NA         NA #>   ba_angle ba_cones fl_leaders wb_buddies gc_distance gc_radius gc_nped #> 1       NA       NA         NA         NA          NA        NA      NA #>   vf_angles #> 1        NA  # Change the utility_variables slot for the agent utility_variables(my_agent) <- data.frame(value = 1) utility_variables(my_agent) #>   value #> 1     1

title: Continuous visual field utility — vf_utility_continuous
text: idea utility function let angle see group members play role utility. , distinguish using cosine maximization – leading maximum utility whenever agent directly looking group member minimum utility whenever group member directly behind agent – sine – leading maximum utility whenever group members directly besides agent minimum utility whenever agent either directly behind group member group member behind agent.

title: Continuous visual field utility — vf_utility_continuous
code: vf_utility_continuous(b_vf, rel_angles, fx = cos)

title: Continuous visual field utility — vf_utility_continuous
text: b_vf Numeric denoting slope utility function. rel_angles Numeric vector containing relative angle cell center predicted positions group members. Typically output get_angles. fx Trigonometric function applied relative angles defining effect (scaled b_vf). Defaults cos, saying maximal utility stems directly looking person (orientation 0). Alternative sin, maximizes utility looking person right next (orientation 90).

title: Continuous visual field utility — vf_utility_continuous
text: Numeric vector containing utility attributed keeping group members within visual field. Returns 0's agent additional group members.

title: Discrete visual field utility — vf_utility_discrete
text: idea utility function matter angle see group member within visual field, long see . translates discrete added disutility whenever group member falls inside non-visual zone behind agent.

code: # Initialize a predped model my_background <- background(shape = rectangle(center = c(0, 0),                                                size = c(2, 2)),                              objects = list())  my_model <- predped(setting = my_background,                      archetypes = c("BaselineEuropean",                                     "DrunkAussie"))  # Access the archetypes slot  weights(my_model) #> [1] 0.5 0.5  # Change the archetypes slot weights(my_model) <- c(0.9, 0.1) weights(my_model) #> [1] 0.9 0.1
